__e: I had no idea if my wife had received my letter, so each day I waited for her at the bus-stop.
I kept waiting for them to come and kill me, but they didn't.
I was home, waiting for her.
I did what they told me and waited for the right moment.
It was like I stored up all that pain, just waiting for the day.
I was waiting for the right moment to show them who I was.
Mine was still out there waiting for me.
I was waiting for the right moment to show them who I was.
I kept waiting for them to come and kill me, but they didn't.
He looked like waiting for something.
I thought it was a love story, but he was just using me until she returned!
And he looked at me... and the whole time, he was only waiting till he knew it was time.
I was waiting for you to tell me.
So there I was sitting next to the bodies of my parents... just waiting for someone to ask me why I killed them.
I waited for her to... to come back home and, uh, we...
When Bobby got shot, I was sittin' in a car, waiting for a guy to come out of a house with his girlfriend.
I waited for her to... to come back home and, uh, we...
If he waited to check the coast was clear before his meeting with Clarence, he could have witnessed a murder rather than committed one.
I waited up to being sure of what they had gone away, and then...
I waited till I saw him leave, like last time.
The next morning, I waited for them to come down and the next afternoon.
I remember waiting one day when he was due to come back.
I've spent the last seven years just waiting for something to happen. I didn't even know what it was.
I knew my husband was at her place.
On the ground, I waited to find the others until I was safe to be around.
While I was waiting for him to come to.
And I waited for whoever it was that was trying to kill me to finish the job.
But as I lay there, waiting for it all to end... I heard her voice.
